alert.note: Alert for Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 3:21PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN UNION AND NORTHEASTERN COLFAX COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM MDT... At 320 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles east of Sugarite, or 13 miles east of Raton, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Folsom. This includes Highway 64 between Mile Markers 352 and 360, and between Mile Markers 362 and 370. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass
